title: Border tree shading neighbor's field
vignette: A large carob on Reuven's land shades Levi's newly planted wheat, stunting growth.

options.text: Owner must trim or uproot; shading is damage.
Tree may stand; farmer must plant away from the border.

title: Four cubits rule (bar metzra)
vignette: Stranger buys a vacant lot; adjacent neighbor claims first-refusal right.

options.text: Sale annulled; neighbor may match the price.
Buyer keeps it; open market trumps neighbor preference.

title: Shared courtyard smokehouse
vignette: Partner installs a fish-smoker in a common yard; odor annoys the other.

options.text: Allowed; common area for anything customary in the city.
Ban noxious uses without unanimous consent.

title: Right of way across private land
vignette: Inner field owner demands path through outer field to reach road.

options.text: Outer field must grant easement for compensation.
No forced passage; inner owner must buy a strip outright.

title: Movable vs. immovable boundary stakes
vignette: Boundary markers were stones (easily moved) not iron rods.

options.text: Owner must pay full for any shift—stones count as secure.
Partial liability; flimsy stakes invite confusion.

title: Leaning wall between gardens
vignette: Old brick wall tilts into neighbor's plot; risk of collapse.

options.text: Both owners share repair cost—benefits both yards.
Side toward which it leans pays entire repair.

title: Digging cistern next to neighbor's well
vignette: Ezra wants a new cistern one cubit from Levi's well.

options.text: Must keep distance (3+ cubits) to prevent water theft.
May dig anywhere on his land; underground water is common.

title: Opening shop in residential alley
vignette: Tenant converts ground room into bakery; neighbors complain about crowds.

options.text: Block business; alley residents may veto increased traffic.
Economic activity allowed unless proven physical damage.

title: Upper vs. lower window privacy
vignette: Reuven adds second-story windows facing Levi's rooftop patio.

options.text: Higher floor needs no consent; eye-line differs.
Any direct view is hezek re'iyah; Levi may object.

title: Jointly owned scroll division
vignette: Two heirs inherit a single Torah scroll; one wants to cut it in half.

options.text: Physically divide—each gets property.
Sell as whole and split money; cutting destroys sanctity.

title: Father's gift on deathbed vs. inheritance
vignette: Dying father deeds orchard to younger son; older son claims double share as firstborn.

options.text: Deed stands; a gift overrides later inheritance rules.
Firstborn still gets double; inheritance begins at death.

title: Found document with blank lines
vignette: Sale deed has skipped spaces that could be forged.

options.text: Invalidate; gaps threaten security.
Accept if signatures overlap margin; spaces irrelevant.

title: Boycotting unfair tax assignments
vignette: Town assigns equal head-tax; rich refuse, poor protest.

options.text: Equal per-capita stands; simplicity beats equity.
Tax by wealth tiers; burden must be proportional.

title: Storefront awning over public road
vignette: Shopowner builds awning 2 cubits above sidewalk.

options.text: City may demand removal; public airspace.
Allowed if safe clearance; precedent of use.

title: Guardian investing orphan's funds
vignette: Trustee considers risky but high-return trade for orphan estate.

options.text: Invest only in low-risk land; preserve principal.
Permissible if personal liability pledged for loss.

title: One writes deed, other pays scribe
vignette: Seller drafts sales deed; buyer refuses to split scribal fee.

options.text: Costs on buyer—benefits him most.
Split equally; both need valid document.

title: Seller keeps small profits from measurement error
vignette: Land sold as 100×100 cubits; survey shows 101×101.

options.text: Buyer returns extra or pays proportionate price.
Minor surplus forgiven under market custom.

title: Tunnel beneath neighbor's house
vignette: Miner extends private tunnel under adjacent dwelling.

options.text: Digging forbidden; undermines support.
Allowed below 15 cubits depth; no realistic damage.

title: Leased house collapses midway
vignette: Tenant prepaid yearly rent; house collapses month 6.

options.text: Landlord refunds remainder—failed to provide dwelling.
Contract stands; collapse an unforeseen accident.

title: Sale of 'house and its contents'
vignette: Deed says "house and everything inside." Does seller include movable furniture?

options.text: Movables included unless explicitly excluded.
Phrase refers to fixtures only; furniture separate.

title: Bird coop vs. neighbor's noise
vignette: Reuven wants dove-cotes; Levi fears cooing disturbs sleep.

options.text: Allowed; normal rural sound.
May bar new coops within 50 cubits.

title: Planting thorn bushes along path
vignette: Farmer lines private path with thorns, injuring passers.

options.text: Owner liable; must remove hazards.
Not liable; trespassers assume risk.

title: Found treasure under leased field
vignette: Tenant ploughs up buried coins.

options.text: Split treasure; both had expectation of benefit.
Landlord owns treasure; embedded in his soil.

title: Double deed error
vignette: Scribe accidentally writes two identical deeds; one reaches registrar first.

options.text: Earlier registration wins; other deed void.
Error taints both; must re-issue single deed.

title: Reneging on a verbal gift
vignette: Elder promises field to nephew verbally, then changes mind before deed signed.

options.text: Mere words not binding; may retract.
Moral obligation to honor promise.

title: Stolen beam built into mansion
vignette: Robber's beam supports his new mansion roof.

options.text: Victim may demand removal even if house demolished.
Robber pays value; beam stays (takkanat hashavim).

title: Craftsman improves raw materials
vignette: Potter hired to fire raw clay adds personal glaze worth extra.

options.text: Clay owner pays only agreed wage; glaze gift.
Must pay added value; craftsman's contribution.

title: Orphans' field sale by guardian
vignette: Guardian sells minor orphans' field for expenses; land later triples in value.

options.text: Sale stands; guardian acted prudently at the time.
Orphans may void sale upon majority.

title: Dividing unequal-quality vineyard
vignette: Partners split vineyard; one side closer to water.

options.text: Numeric half each; quality disparity ignored.
Adjust acreage or payment to equalize value.

title: Firstborn sold birthright
vignette: Firstborn sold double share during father's life; father now dies.

options.text: Sale void—birthright vests only at father's death.
Sale valid; right was a transferable expectancy.

title: Two dated deeds, same property
vignette: Elder gifted his orchard to cousin A in Nissan and cousin B in Iyyar; both deeds are valid and no one has taken possession.

options.text: Earlier deed (Nissan) wins; first document controls.
Court applies shuda-dedayana: judge's discretion to choose most deserving cousin.

title: Possession claim after three years
vignette: Levi farms Reuven's lot unchallenged for three years and now claims ownership; Reuven says he was abroad.

options.text: Possessor wins; hazakah of three years is proof.
Absent owner may reclaim; possession unchallenged only if owner was nearby.

title: Balcony overlooking courtyard
vignette: Reuven builds a projecting balcony that peers directly into shared courtyard windows.

options.text: Neighbors may force removal—hezek re'iyah (loss of privacy).
Balcony allowed if railing height prevents direct view.

title: Water seepage from rooftop pool
vignette: Upper-story resident installs kiddie-pool; leaks stain ceiling of lower flat.

options.text: Upper resident liable—abnormal water load.
Liability only if damage exceeds normal rain seepage standard.

title: Lost bond found in marketplace
vignette: Unsigned promissory note is discovered folded in street; lender later claims it.

options.text: Finder returns note; lender likely dropped before signing.
Finder may keep; unsigned note has no value or identifiers.

title: Right to airspace sale
vignette: Seller conveys house 'to heaven's height'; buyer plans a third floor that darkens neighbor's skylight.

options.text: Buyer may build; airspace conveyed without limit.
Neighbor may block; excessive height newly harms light/air.

title: Equal division vs. lottery among heirs
vignette: Four brothers inherit four parcels of unequal fertility.

options.text: Appraise and let each take equal value portions.
Draw lots; providence decides, saves appraisal costs.

title: Guardian's advance expenses
vignette: Orphan's guardian spends his own funds for seed and tools before court approval, crop prospers.

options.text: Guardian reimbursed plus wage; benefited estate.
Gets only expenses; taking initiative without consent limits reward.
